My daughter told me about this movie because she can see how hard I'm working to become a part of the writing community. I'm an African American, disabled, middled-aged, college-educated woman. But I'm also a writer who is EXTREMELY PROUD of her race, and wants others to know our community is about heartache, yet it is also about love, community, and so much more! 

I hope this movie sheds a bright light on what African Americans (and really, ANY underrepresented writer and/or other professional within this industry) face as we navigate these treacherous waters. 

It's AMAZING how I sat (just yesterday) reflecting on why the writing industry is ripe for a Civil Rights movement of its own. I'm ecstatic to be a part of that movement, as my AUTHENTIC self.

Bravo for the trailer! Now....let's bring on the movie!❤❤
